intro: Lindera motuoensis, commonly known as the Motuo Lindera, is a rare evergreen shrub native to the Yunnan Province of China. It belongs to the Lauraceae family, which includes laurel trees and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the spring. Its fruit is a drupe, containing a single seed, and it thrives in moist, shaded forest environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
